alert.note: Alert for Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 3:57PM EDT until July 02 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Georgia, including the following area, Richmond. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 357 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Augusta, Augusta, Hephzibah, South Augusta, Glendale, Daniel Field, Augusta Mall, Augusta Regional Airport, Summerville, Midtown, Blythe, Miles Park, Glenn Hills, Richmond County Recreation Center, Hillcrest Memorial Park, Kendan Park, Diamond Lakes Regional Park, Westover, Minnick Park and Pendleton King Park. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 3 and 15. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
